item.title: Change
item.description:
What makes it so difficult for me to be who I believe I want to be? Why is it so hard to be the early rising, studious and bright, meditating, guy who has a clean consciousness? No gaming, no media binging, no drugs, no porn. Meaning in the useful things. I have been writing about this for five years by now.

I have progressed sure.

But I have in key points not made the progress I had hoped for.

item.title: The i-th day
item.description: I think the really difficult thing about chronic diseases is not the disease itself. It is the need to accept the inevitability of its permanence. More specifically, it is the feeling to not be able to cope with it on the i-th day. It is not difficult to live with an alignment for one day, it is not difficult to live with an alignment for 100 days. But it is very difficult to live with an alignment forever. No resource is permanent. And these suckers are very good at grinding you down.

item.title: OF LOVE AND FEAR AND COURAGE AND HUMANS
item.description: A couple of days ago, I was sitting in a cafe, talking to a friend about affection, courage, and fear of the future. As we were talking, we started to discuss emotions and their relationship to Zukunftsangst. One particular question we tried to answer got stuck in my head: ‚ÄòHow can we be certain that feelings and love will remain for years?‚Äô Within that question sits in my opinion Zukunftsangst. We talked about this for a while, but it continued to work in me over the past days. I don’t think there is a right or a wrong answer, but here is my view on this question.

item.title: Graffiti
item.description:
……except from a book, that may or may not be written……

Writing something, somewhere in a public place has always been a go-to tool for those without any other means of resistance to stick it to the current regime. But since the advent of nano-tech coatings and fast clean-up drones, spray and paint have lost their ‚Äúfuck-the-system‚Äù value. But the world keeps spinning and scientific knowledge generally doesn‚Äôt want to be tied up like a hooker too careless to agree to some mild bondage play up in the back alley brothels on the soft underbelly of Tokyos shadow world. Now the tool of choice is microbial bio-paint. A mixture of a calcium-rich deployment substrate and lab engineered bacteria that have all but two functions spliced from their genetic composition. The first converts the deployment fuel into highly corrosive fluorinated acid that decomposes anything including hardened glass into a workable canvas to spread ‚Äúthe message‚Äù. The second, is a highly optimised gene expression protocol that recombines the available molecules from the canvas and the deployment substrate into a almost indestructible calcium-silicate crust, that remains of a surface longer than the time humans have populated rock-3. Put the fully enriched mixture anywhere and within seconds the gene edited cells will engrave themselves into the surface. Used carefully, you can write anything anywhere and make sure it remains there to be seen until the surface gets demolished. More expensive versions also embed any combination of fluorescence particles into the mix to make artists mental arithmetics against the system pop even more.

item.title: Parallel Diffusion Models of Operator and Image for Blind Inverse Problems
item.description:
Introduction

Abstract

Diffusion model-based inverse problem solvers have demonstrated state-of-the-art performance in cases where the forward operator is known (i.e. non-blind). However, the applicability of the method to blind inverse problems has yet to be explored. In this work, we show that we can indeed solve a family of blind inverse problems by constructing another diffusion prior for the forward operator. Specifically, parallel reverse diffusion guided by gradients from the intermediate stages enables joint optimization of both the forward operator parameters as well as the image, such that both are jointly estimated at the end of the parallel reverse diffusion procedure. We show the efficacy of our method on two representative tasks ‚Äì blind deblurring, and imaging through turbulence ‚Äì and show that our method yields state-of-the-art performance, while also being flexible to be applicable to general blind inverse problems when we know the functional forms.

item.title: Tokyo
item.description: Sometimes I miss Tokyo to the cellular level. It is insane how much this city has left an imprint on me. In my memory I feel the heat of the asphalt radiating into my face while I am walking through Shimo-kitazawa, Hara-juku or Shibuya after a day of sun in the early summer. It is blissful. It is liberating. It is absolutely fantastic and dread nothing more than to one day feel like I will be too old to do these things.
